snippet: The study’s authors said the data indicates that treatment has not made much of a difference, if any, for the tens of thousands of women a year who are told they have this condition.
abstract: News Analysis; study in journal JAMA Oncology concludes aggressive treatment of very early breast cancer stage known as ductal carcinoma in situ has little effect on breast cancer incidence and patient survival rates; finding has inflamed debate over whether DCIS can be considered real cancer and how to handle it.
lead_paragraph: The study’s authors said the data indicates that treatment has not made much of a difference, if any, for the tens of thousands of women a year who are told they have this condition.

headline.print_headline: Decades of Data Fail to Resolve Debate on Treating Tiny Breast Lesions
headline.main: Decades of Data Fail to Resolve Debate on Treating Tiny Breast Lesions
